page.title: 04INDUSTRY FORDS BOREHAM 2
page.content: The Ford Motor Company now own the airfield, and it would seem ideal for the purpose it is used for.The runways remain, and on these both production and prototype vehicles are tested.Part of the runway has been adapted to test the suspension of vehicles and the varied surfaces include a quarter of a mile of--corrugated surface, simulated potholes and cobbles.There is also a rough course of sand and gravel, with various gradients.The man made mound has a gradient of 1 in 6 on one side and 1 in 5 the other.Wading troughs have been made to test for corrosion. The skin of the hanger remains,and with a new roof is now used as a workshop. A new building houses the designers,and general office, and the computers,that are linked with Fords Dagenham.
